column1: #Text=## Attention With Varying Receptive Fields Network
#Text=A key application in computer vision is performing super-resolution of degraded
#Text=images by learning a mapping from low-resolution to high-resolution.
#Text=created a library of various super-resolution models and modules, along with
#Text=implement experiments designed to determine how additions of enhanced
#Text=convolutions and novel modules encompassed in our attention with varying
#Text=receptive fields network affects performance gains for the task of image
#Text=This repository was created to contain the experiments and super-resolution
#Text=models for our 2021 ICVS paper titled "[Thermal Image Super-Resolution Using
#Text=learning and computer vision code not only for thermal image super-resolution,
#Text=but also for super-resolution of the visual image space.
#Text=If you find this project useful, then please consider citing our work.
#Text=  title={Thermal image super-resolution using second-order channel attention with varying receptive fields},
#Text=  author={Gutierrez, Nolan B and Beksi, William J},
#Text=  booktitle={Proceedings of the International Conference on Computer Vision Systems (ICVS)},
#Text=To run the experiments within this repository, `opencv`, `numpy`, `tensorflow`,
#Text=and `pillow` need to be installed along with their dependencies.
#Text=were conducted on an Ubuntu 20.04 machine using an Anaconda 3 environment.
#Text=experiments were run with an NVIDIA GPU and CUDA.
#Text=the following commands from a terminal with Anaconda 3 installed.
